The cartels are changing the way they operate, and we have to change too. This week I've been meeting with law enforcement all over #PA13 to see what we can do better to protect our communities. #secureourborder #BuildTheWall https://www.publicopiniononline.com/story/news/2019/05/30/meth-creeping-into-southcentral-pa-police-tell-u-s-lawmaker/1284217001/ …

Mueller told us what we've already known - There's no collusion. There's no crime. It's time for the United States Congress to get back to work on the impotant issues facing the American people such as securing the border. pic.twitter.com/lHtgbsO3yi
There is no component of our community that is spared from the drug epidemic that is being driven by the border crisis. We have to secure our border. pic.twitter.com/6PsdQqULqW

The porous border that allows the drugs to permeate into our wonderful communities has given me a deeper understanding of what I’ve been sent to Washington to do. Addressing our drug epidemic at home cannot be done without securing the southern border. https://www.therecordherald.com/news/20190529/congressman-joyce-hears-from-local-officials-on-drugs-border …

This afternoon I continued to examine the impact the crisis on the southern border is having on the influx of drugs we are seeing in the communities of #PA13. Law enforcement from Franklin and Adams had great insight during our meeting in Waynesboro this afternoon. pic.twitter.com/HbaCT4mgfO

This morning I was joined by law enforcement and community leaders in Altoona to discuss the drug epidemic that our communities are facing. We talked about the need to act now to secure our border and stop the flow of these harmful drugs into our country. pic.twitter.com/l4HSEcNrb3

Yesterday afternoon I was in Altoona where I toured Curry Supply. Curry Supply builds and repairs hydraulic cylinders, pumps, motors, and valves. After the tour, I met with Altoona Mayor Matt Pacifico to discuss the opioid crisis. pic.twitter.com/iFw1HeJWWD

If it is between open borders or for keeping Americans safe and secure, I am on the side of safe and secure, and I am going to do everything in my power to secure the border and make America safe -> https://www.dailyamerican.com/news/local/somerset/joyce-to-wolf-send-national-guard-troops-to-southern-border/article_2672533d-0718-51ca-a8c6-c68b4fea2e09.html …

This is the time to pause and pray that God has welcomed them home. It is a time to pray that our country will always respect and honor those who have fallen to maintain the independence of America. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HSo6yUrgVZM&app=desktop …

As we observe Memorial Day, and at the same time are nearing the 75th anniversary of the invasion of Normandy, I thank all of those fallen military and their families who have given their lives for the freedom that we enjoy today and every day. pic.twitter.com/gvNTJCFy4Q

➡️ Make sure to keep children under the age of one out of the sun pic.twitter.com/XfLp8y5p2g

How on earth can my colleagues across the aisle justify limiting the resources children with disabilities have at their disposal to grow and to thrive?

I condemn the Democrats for their attack on children with disabilities today.

As a father of a child with a disability, I know how difficult it is to get disabled children the services that they deserve. Having flexible payment mechanisms to enhance the opportunities to access therapies opens doors that are otherwise closed. pic.twitter.com/SQSbOZclyY

While the crisis at our southern border can only be resolved by fixing the loopholes in our immigration laws that are perpetuating it, an immediate surge in manpower at the border is absolutely necessary while Congress continues to work through long-term legislative solutions.
Pennsylvania’s National Guard could provide Border Patrol agents with the support necessary to free them up to spend more time catching persons of interest.

Border Patrol agents are spending far too much time on humanitarian and administrative tasks, which is hindering their ability to apprehend dangerous individuals such as drug smugglers and cartel members.
While I had a number of takeaways from my recent visit to the southern border, it is clear that a major obstacle that our law enforcement officials are facing is a lack of manpower.

Today I joined @GReschenthaler @RepSmucker @RepScottPerry and @MikeKellyPA to request that Governor Wolf offer as many of Pennsylvania's National Guard troops as possible to @realDonaldTrump in order to help combat the crisis at the southern border. https://johnjoyce.house.gov/media/press-releases/joyce-spearheads-letter-governor-wolf-urging-national-guard-support-be-offered …

Today @DHSMcAleenan came and testified before my committee and discussed how the National Guard has been "absolutely essential" in combatting the crisis on the southern border. @DHSgov  → https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JM72pWIn3-Y …

This morning I put my doctor’s coat back on to offer information and skin cancer screenings to some of my colleagues and others who work on Capitol Hill. With the first holiday weekend of the summer approaching, I encourage everyone to be mindful of their exposure to the sun. pic.twitter.com/BjsnEpXnpu

#ICYMI - Last week I stood up to Nancy Pelosi for playing politics with three prescription drug pricing bills that should have passed in a bipartisan manner. Read more about it here. ->  http://www.altoonamirror.com/news/local-news/2019/05/joyce-blasts-pelosi-over-drug-votes/ …

Even the Washington Post recognizes that Ms. Pelosi’s politicized prescription drug package is dead on arrival in the Senate, and if she really cares about enacting realistic health care reforms she would bring up the three bipartisan bills separately so we can pass them.

This week she sabotaged three perfectly good pieces of prescription drug pricing legislation by pairing them with measures that will continue to perpetuate the failed health care system that is Obamacare.

Through her actions the last two weeks, it’s clear Nancy Pelosi would rather try to score political points than make health care more affordable and accessible for patients. -> https://johnjoyce.house.gov/media/press-releases/joyce-blasts-pelosi-playing-politics-bipartisan-prescription-drug-reforms …

Was a privilege to be with @realDonaldTrump this afternoon as he unveiled a common sense plan to modernize our immigration laws. When it comes to trade negotiations with China, we need to get a good deal now instead of kicking the can down the road like other leaders have done in the past. President Trump has the long game in his heart. He knows how to negotiate and we need to support him. pic.twitter.com/Tc3uh7hda6

Instead of spending time on political stunts, both parties should honor their campaign promises to lower prescription drug costs and bring that bill to the floor for a vote as soon as possible.
The Ensuring Timely Access to Generics Act has bipartisan support in both chambers of Congress, and would make health care more affordable for patients across the country.
There are plenty of common sense health care initiatives moving through Congress that would serve the American people well, but we just do not get the opportunity to vote on them.

House Democrats just passed a bill that they claim protects pre-existing conditions despite the reality that it does nothing of the sort. 

Read my full statement on this mirage of a health care reform here →   https://johnjoyce.house.gov/media/press-releases/joyce-condemns-democrats-wasting-taxpayer-time-and-resources-mirage-health-care … https://twitter.com/RepJohnJoyce/status/1126607771871395848 …
